explains: adj. 明确的，真实的；可触摸的，可感知的
wordGroup: tangible benefits 显著实惠，有形利益
tangible and intangible assets 有形和无形资产；有形资产和无形资产
tangible value 有形资产的价值
tangible proof 明确的证据；确实证据；可见证据

sentences.en: But unlike meditation, craft activities result in tangible and often useful products that can enhance self-esteem.
sentences.cn: 但与冥想不同的是，手工活动会产生有形的、往往有用的产品，可以增强自尊心。

sentences.en: They would have to concentrate on natural processes that continue at a constant rate and that also leave some sort of tangible record in the rocks.
sentences.cn: 他们必须专注于以恒定速度持续的自然过程，并且在岩石中留下某种有形的记录。

sentences.en: As one writer observes: "Although it is now evident that artefacts are as easily altered as chronicles, public faith in their veracity endures: a tangible relic seems ipso facto real."
sentences.cn: 正如一位作家所观察到的：“尽管现在很明显，手工艺品和编年史一样容易被篡改，但公众对其真实性的信心依然存在：一件有形的遗物本身似乎就是真实的。”
